dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Closing the door to the teaching profession with a score of just 75 points is like, uh, building a house on a foundation of sand.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Closing the door to the teaching profession with a score of just seventy five points is like, uh, building a house on a foundation of sand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Mazhilis deputy Irina Smirnova is really concerned about this trend in Kazakhstan—she's pointing out that minimum scores for some teaching grants dropped to as low as 81 and 75 points this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Mazhilis deputy Irina Smirnova is really concerned about this trend in Kazakhstan-she's pointing out that minimum scores for some teaching grants dropped to as low as eighty one and seventy five points this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mazhilis deputy Irina Smirnova believes this will attract truly motivated and the strongest candidates. According to the published list of students admitted to educational grants for the 2024/2025 academic year, the minimum score for the specialty 'Pedagogy and Psychology' was only 81 points, while for the field of 'Preschool Education and Upbringing' it was 75 points.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty steep drop from last year's numbers, right? Like, wasn't it 89 for Pedagogy and Psychology before?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty steep drop from last year's numbers, right? Like, wasn't it eighty nine for Pedagogy and Psychology before?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For comparison, in the 2023/2024 academic year, the minimum scores for these same specialties were 89 and 75 points, respectively," noted the deputy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. She's arguing that we need to attract stronger, more motivated candidates from the start—not just letting anyone in with bare-minimum scores.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. She's arguing that we need to attract stronger, more motivated candidates from the start-not just letting anyone in with bare-minimum scores.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In her opinion, this will attract truly motivated and the strongest candidates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And she's looking at international examples too. Finland only accepts the top ten percent of graduates into teaching programs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And she's looking at international examples too. Finland only accepts the top ten percent of graduates into teaching programs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Finland, only 10 percent of the best school graduates can become applicants to pedagogical universities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they look beyond just test scores—they evaluate empathy, communication, all that stuff. It's not just about academics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they look beyond just test scores-they evaluate empathy, communication, all that stuff. It's not just about academics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Candidates are evaluated not only on academic success but also on personal qualities such as empathy, communication skills, and stress resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, 'cause teaching's such a human-centered profession. You can't just be book-smart.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, 'cause teaching's such a human-centered profession. You can't just be book-smart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And then there's Japan, where they do these long internships under mentors. It's like they're preparing people for the real classroom from day one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And then there's Japan, where they do these long internships under mentors. It's like they're preparing people for the real classroom from day one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Japan, future educators undergo lengthy internships in schools under the guidance of experienced mentors, which allows them to adapt to real working conditions," she said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So Smirnova's pushing for a unified minimum score across all teaching grant subjects, to kind of raise that bar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Smirnova's pushing for a unified minimum score across all teaching grant subjects, to kind of raise that bar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this context, Smirnova proposed establishing a unified minimum passing score across all subjects for those applying for pedagogical specialties with grants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she even suggests letting top graduates choose where they want to work—like an incentive to excel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she even suggests letting top graduates choose where they want to work-like an incentive to excel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To enhance motivation, the deputy suggested introducing a mechanism for distributing the best graduates: for those who complete their studies with honors, there should be an opportunity to choose their place of work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's smart. Motivate people with opportunity, not just obligation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's smart. Motivate people with opportunity, not just obligation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And timing-wise, this is super relevant—the Unified National Test is happening right now in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And timing-wise, this is super relevant-the Unified National Test is happening right now in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is worth noting that on May 16, the main stage of the Unified National Test (UNT) began in Kazakhstan, which will last until July 7.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so this discussion could actually influence policy pretty soon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so this discussion could actually influence policy pretty soon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Hopefully. 'Cause if we want great teachers, we've gotta set the standard high from the beginning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hopefully. 'Cause if we want great teachers, we've gotta set the standard high from the beginning.
